reviewText: I didn't expect much from this movie, particularly because I'd watched another movie which focused on the death penalty beforehand and it was awful and cheesy. That movie was called 'Dead Man Walking.'What a pleasant surprise that such a real story could actually be portayed in such a moving way, and yet still keep the dark edge of the subject that always was there.We're taken inside prison walls with Raymond Graham, a seemingly confident man with a witty sense of humour which is unusual for someone who is about to be put to death for the murder of a seventeen year old convenience store worker. He is a man who doesn't realise just how serious his fate is and is still holding out hope of being saved, and as the clock ticks on, his confidence cracks, but never fades completely.The acting of this movie is wonderful. Especially Jeff Fahey who plays Raymond. You could almost believe you were watching a documentary rather than a movie if you go by the acting of the serious yet lighthearted man whom he portrays.Most of all, this movie is straight to the point. No messing around.This is a film version of the execution of Raymond Graham. It's a true story, it's and it may open your eyes to just what people on death row go through before their hour of doom and how even when they have people surrounding them, willing to talk before they're led inside the injection room, they know that in the end they're not on their side, and how you can still feel alone even if you're in a conversation.And of course, that when faced with the grim reality of death, every man has fear in his heart.Raymond Graham - perhaps one of the more meaningful and deeper prisoners on death row. Just view the movie and see if you don't shed a few tears and feel the sting of compassion as you watch feel as if you're in the jail cell with him.A very good movie - highly recommended.
summary: "You put the bullets in the gun but get someone else to pull the trigger!"

reviewText: For sure some of the viewers says it is boring because the setting is only inside prison.  But it is a nice movie if one sees it as a narrative of a story of a man to be executed to death by lethal injection.  I even suggest the movie to be viewed by junior college or high school students so they will realize what is the future for them if they live in the life of the prisoner.

reviewText: This was well done. The movie shared each aspect of the people involved. You felt for Raymond, Raymond's family, and the family of the boy that Raymond killed. Was there malicious intent? Is capital punishment murder? Is it the best option? There were lots of emotions and questions that this movie stirred in me. I was an advent supporter of capital punishment but the contents of this movie has me doubting.

reviewText: However, I haven't seen White Hunter, Black Heart, yet.  Time will tell.Fahey looks so young in this one, and I do not remember the year of it's creation.  The description stated that Raymond Graham, on the day of his execution, goes from cocky to terrified.  This was very well evinced byFahey.  Pretty intense, and I imagine much like what any man would experience in those shoes.With a start up like this, I would have thought Jeff Fahey would havecarried onward and upward, but for some reason he chose B Movie Sheol.This has the look of the era, shot on videotape, not film, but that only serves to make it seem a little more "real".Hey, Jeff, what happened?

reviewText: This film seems to run real time with the last hours of a condemned killer. Exploring the emotions of all concerned, the killer's family, the victim's family, guards, chaplain, warden, governor and legal teams, the film held my attention throughout. This would also be great as a stage play.

reviewText: Standard movie against Capital punishment.  The acting was good, the story iffy.  I found it hard to empathize with the convict since his death was a easier death than his victim endured.  Maybe its the age of the film, but the convict's story could have showed more grit and honestly.  He was supposed to be a hardened criminal who spent years in death row.  I gave rated the movie a three and that was being generous.
summary: The acting was good, the story iffy
Title: N/A

reviewText: I found this movie to be even more engaging than Dead Man Walking - which was also excellent.  This goes into the finite details of what goes on behind the scenes and during the "wait" for the walk to death.  It also shows the effect the death penalty has on family members and those trying to work for a stay of execution.  Excellent acting and realistic script.  Highly recommend.
